txt.en: 'You did not know him as long as we, but you proved yourself a stouthearted friend to Nykr, my good [placeholder].\n\n'It will be through the noble actions of people like yourself, willing to both fight for the future and respect the traditions of the past, that the glory of Khazad-dûm will once more be sung throughout the world!'
'I met him in passing several times. Good craftsman, could hoist a tankard with the best of us.'
In His Memory
'Let us all salute Nykr! To the memory of Nykr Locket-bearer!'
'Nykr's passing will be long mourned, and his life's story sung until I too pass, or may my beard be cut from my face.'

'Ah, I remember Nykr well. He will be missed. When we were but little dwarves together, I remember once he hid from me a gem I'd mined myself, with my own little pick, which I prized above all my other possessions, until I apologized to another child I had insulted. I took years to fully forgive him....'
'O, what a grievous day! I am moved... I shall write an epic ode to the memory of the Locket-bearer!'
'I met him in passing several times. Good craftsman, could hoist a tankard with the best of us.'
'What? Nykr, dead? This news bows my shoulders and weighs upon my heart. It seems that every day we receive more dire news... It makes me wish I had never heard the name Khazad-dûm!'

You should visit, in no particular order: the Shadowed Refuge, Jazârgund, the Deep Descent, Anazârmekhem, the Dolven-view, the Chamber of the Cross-roads, the Orc-watch, the Twenty-first Hall, Durin's Threshold, and the Rotting Cellar.\n\nKúli wants you to speak with Nykr Locket-bearer's friends in each of the dwarf-outposts throughout Moria, telling them of his death and hoisting a memorial tankard in his name with them each.
'Let us all salute Nykr! To the memory of Nykr Locket-bearer!'

'You did not know him as long as we, but you proved yourself a stouthearted friend to Nykr, my good [placeholder].\n\n'It will be through the noble actions of people like yourself, willing to both fight for the future and respect the traditions of the past, that the glory of Khazad-dûm will once more be sung throughout the world!'
Kúli can be found north of the Chittering Hole in the Redhorn Lodes.\n\nHaving muddled your wits with Nykr Locket-bearer's friends all over Moria, you ought to return to Kúli, his kinsman.
'Nykr's passing will be long mourned, and his life's story sung until I too pass, or may my beard be cut from my face.'
'Nykr died as he lived, brave and faithful to the lovely Finna. May all of us find in our lives the happiness theirs held!'
'O, what a grievous day! I am moved... I shall write an epic ode to the memory of the Locket-bearer!'
'What? Nykr, dead? This news bows my shoulders and weighs upon my heart. It seems that every day we receive more dire news... it makes me wish I had never heard the name Khazad-dûm!'
'Ho there, [placeholder]! Raise a glass to my fallen friend!'
'Nykr died as he lived, brave and faithful to the lovely Finna. May all of us find in our lives the happiness theirs held!'
'I grieve to hear your tidings, [placeholder]. What tragic news to have to spread!'

'Poor Finna! I pity the messenger who delivers this news. I don't suppose you're going to the Lonely Mountain...? No, that would have been too easy, I suppose. Ah, well. To Nykr! Let us hoist a tankard in his memory!'
'Nykr is dead? What woe! This is a sad day indeed. Never again shall he and I quaff my son's good ale together!'
Drink to Nykr's memory with his friends ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
You have celebrated the life and death of Nykr Locket-bearer with his friends ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Talk to Kúli at the Chittering Hole
'I grieve to hear your tidings, [placeholder]. What tragic news to have to spread!'

'Poor Finna! I pity the messenger who delivers this news. I don't suppose you're going to the Lonely Mountain...? No, that would have been too easy, I suppose. Ah, well. To Nykr! Let us hoist a tankard in his memory!'
'Nykr is dead? What woe! This is a sad day indeed. Never again shall he and I quaff my son's good ale together!'
Drink to Nykr's memory with his friends ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Kúli wants Nykr's death to be reported and celebrated in the true dwarf-fashion.
You have celebrated the life and death of Nykr Locket-bearer with his friends ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'[placeholder], Nykr's passing is a cause for great grief. I can think of only one way to properly celebrate his life, and death, in correct accordance with our most ancient and venerable dwarf-traditions.\n\n'Nykr was friends with many on this expedition, and they are stationed from the Hollin Gate to the ruins of the Bridge of Khazad-dûm. Will you honour Nykr's memory with them, by quaffing a good ale with each of them where they are staying at the ten major encampments of my people throughout the Mines?'
